Dex Entry: Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This Pokémon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.
Title: Humming Pokémon

Name: Zangoose
Dex Entry:
Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets
up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares
a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
Title: Cat Ferret Pokémon

Name: Seviper
Dex Entry:
Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes
and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not
give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
Title: Fang Snake Pokémon

Name: Lunatone
Dex Entry:
It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike
40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
Title: Meteorite Pokémon

Name: Solrock
Dex Entry:
Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is
strong during the daytime. When it spins, its
body shines.
Title: Meteorite Pokémon

Name: Barboach
Dex Entry:
Makes its home in swamps with murky water. The poor visibility
hides this Pokémon from predators, and the slime on its body
makes grasping it difficult.
Title: Whiskers Pokémon

Name: Whiscash
Dex Entry:
Strikes its caudal fin against the swamp bed to shake the ground
and startle its prey. It will then swallow the fleeing prey whole.
People mistook this behavior as the cause of earthquakes.
Title: Whiskers Pokémon

Name: Corphish
Dex Entry:
It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped
to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.
Title: Ruffian Pokémon

Name: Crawdaunt
Dex Entry:
A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will
crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.
Title: Rogue Pokémon

Name: Baltoy
Dex Entry:
It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving,
it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even
when asleep.
Title: Clay Doll Pokémon

Name: Claydol
Dex Entry:
It appears to have been born from clay dolls
made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to
float and move.
Title: Clay Doll Pokémon

Name: Lileep
Dex Entry:
Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey
comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with
petallike tentacles.
Title: Sea Lily Pokémon

Name: Cradily
Dex Entry:
Once Cradily catches prey in its tentacles,
it digests them whole and absorbs their nutrients.
Title: Barnacle Pokémon

Name: Anorith
Dex Entry:
Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings
through the water like oars on a boat. This
Pokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.
Title: Old Shrimp Pokémon

Name: Armaldo
Dex Entry:
Though it lives on land, it’s also a good swimmer.
It dives into the ocean in search of prey, using its
sharp claws to take down its quarry.
Title: Plate Pokémon

Name: Feebas
Dex Entry:
It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is
very hardy and can survive on little water.
Title: Fish Pokémon

Name: Milotic
Dex Entry:
It’s said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty
will calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.
Title: Tender Pokémon

Name: Castform
Dex Entry:
Its form changes depending on the weather.
The rougher conditions get, the rougher
Castform’s disposition!
Title: Weather Pokémon

Name: Castform
Dex Entry: Castform changes to this form when it basks in bright sunlight. When you touch its glowing skin, it feels all dried out!
Title: Weather Pokémon

Name: Castform
Dex Entry: This is Castform's form when pelted by rain. In an experiment where it was placed in a shower, this Pokémon didn't change to this form.
Title: Weather Pokémon

Name: Castform
Dex Entry: This is Castform's form when caught in a hailstorm. Its whole body is chilled, and its skin is partially frozen!
Title: Weather Pokémon

Name: Kecleon
Dex Entry:
Its color changes for concealment and also
when its mood or health changes. The darker
the color, the healthier it is.
Title: Color Swap Pokémon

Name: Shuppet
Dex Entry:
There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house
where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”
Title: Puppet Pokémon

Name: Banette
Dex Entry:
Resentment at being cast off made it spring into
being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy
it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.
Title: Marionette Pokémon

Name: Banette
Dex Entry: Mega Evolution increases its vindictiveness, and the cursing power that was held back by its zipper comes spilling out.
Title: Marionette Pokémon

Name: Duskull
Dex Entry:
I've heard that the children of Hisui all begin to behave once
they've been told the story of how this Pokémon roams about
before the witching hour to spirit away misbehaving children.
Title: Requiem Pokémon

Name: Dusclops
Dex Entry:
There are rumors that peeking inside its bandage-wrapped body
will cause one to get pulled in through the gaps between the
bandages, never to return. I've been too scared to verify.
Title: Beckon Pokémon

Name: Tropius
Dex Entry:
Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck.
In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.
Title: Fruit Pokémon

Name: Chimecho
Dex Entry:
Can emit waves of air powerful enough to knock out prey taller
than itself. I hypothesize that it amplifies the faint sound of wind
within its body.
Title: Wind Chime Pokémon

Name: Absol
Dex Entry:
Because of this Pokémon’s ability to detect
danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer
of doom.
Title: Disaster Pokémon

Name: Absol
Dex Entry: It converts the energy from Mega Evolution into an intimidating aura. Fainthearted people expire from shock at the sight of it.
Title: Disaster Pokémon

Name: Wynaut
Dex Entry:
It tends to move in a pack with others.
They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.
Title: Bright Pokémon

Name: Snorunt
Dex Entry:
Arrives alongside the first snow. It's thought that homes Snorunt
visit will prosper for many generations. By tradition, one might
offer a lump of ice made from pure water at one's front door.
Title: Snow Hat Pokémon

Name: Glalie
Dex Entry:
It covers its body with an armor of ice harder than steel. Uses its
breath to freeze prey, which it then devours as if they were
frozen desserts.
Title: Face Pokémon

Name: Glalie
Dex Entry: The power of Mega Evolution was so strong that it smashed Glalie's jaw. Its inability to eat very well leaves Glalie irritated.
Title: Face Pokémon

Name: Spheal
Dex Entry:
During the season when drift ice approaches the shore, Spheal
prefers living on the ice—where fewer predators lurk—rather
than the land. Its fur retains heat superbly and resists harsh cold.
Title: Clap Pokémon

Name: Sealeo
Dex Entry:
Its white whiskers are very sensitive. Sealeo will balance Spheal
on the tip of its nose, checking its scent and its feel to be sure
the Spheal is healthy.
Title: Ball Roll Pokémon

Name: Walrein
Dex Entry:
Its thick tusks are strong enough to shatter drift ice. They have
been known to break, but they will grow back by the next year.
The Hisui region is well known for these broken tusks.
Title: Ice Break Pokémon

Name: Clamperl
Dex Entry:
Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious.
They can be more than 10 times as costly
as Shellder’s pearls.
Title: Bivalve Pokémon

Name: Huntail
Dex Entry:
Deep seas are their habitat. According to
tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore,
something unfortunate will happen.
Title: Deep Sea Pokémon

Name: Gorebyss
Dex Entry:
It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The
leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it
becomes food for other Pokémon.
Title: South Sea Pokémon

Name: Relicanth
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea
exploration. Its appearance hasn’t changed in
100,000,000 years, so it’s called a living fossil.
Title: Longevity Pokémon

Name: Luvdisc
Dex Entry:
Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm
seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space
between Corsola’s branches.
Title: Rendezvous Pokémon

Name: Bagon
Dex Entry:
Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form
groups with others of its kind. It also has a head
hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.
Title: Rock Head Pokémon

Name: Shelgon
Dex Entry:
Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating
any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once
all its energy stores are used up.
Title: Endurance Pokémon

Name: Salamence
Dex Entry:
While basking in the joy of flight generally keeps
this Pokémon in high spirits, Salamence turns into
an uncontrollable menace if something angers it.
Title: Dragon Pokémon

Name: Salamence
Dex Entry: It puts its forelegs inside its shell to streamline itself for flight. Salamence flies at high speeds over all kinds of topographical features.
Title: Dragon Pokémon

Name: Beldum
Dex Entry:
The cells in this Pokémon’s body are composed
of magnetic material. Instead of blood, magnetic
forces flow through Beldum’s body.
Title: Iron Ball Pokémon

Name: Metang
Dex Entry:
Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon
flies at high speeds, weaving through harsh
mountain terrain in pursuit of prey.
Title: Iron Claw Pokémon

Name: Metagross
Dex Entry:
Metagross is the result of the fusion of two
Metang. This Pokémon defeats its opponents
through use of its supercomputer-level brain.
Title: Iron Leg Pokémon

Name: Metagross
Dex Entry: Mega Evolution stimulated its brain. It emerged as a ruthless Pokémon that will clutch at any means of ensuring its victories.
Title: Iron Leg Pokémon

Name: Regirock
Dex Entry:
Cutting-edge technology was used to study
the internals of this Pokémon’s rock body, but
nothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.
Title: Rock Peak Pokémon

Name: Regice
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon’s body is made of solid ice. It’s
said that Regice was born beneath thick ice in
the ice age.
Title: Iceberg Pokémon

Name: Registeel
Dex Entry:
It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep
underground in the planet’s mantle and that it
emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.
Title: Iron Pokémon

Name: Latias
Dex Entry: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.
Title: Eon Pokémon

Name: Latias
Dex Entry:
Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding
human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down.
The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts
light to alter its appearance.
Title: Eon Pokémon

Name: Latios
Dex Entry: It is a highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its forelegs in flight, it can overtake jet planes.
Title: Eon Pokémon

Name: Latios
Dex Entry:
Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a
compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a
jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.
Title: Eon Pokémon

Name: Kyogre
Dex Entry:
Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself.
Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon,
as each sought to gain the power of nature.
Title: Sea Basin Pokémon

Name: Kyogre
Dex Entry: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.
Title: Sea Basin Pokémon

Name: Groudon
Dex Entry:
Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power,
it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to
erupt and expand the landmass of the world.
Title: Continent Pokémon

Name: Groudon
Dex Entry: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.
Title: Continent Pokémon

Name: Rayquaza
Dex Entry: Rayquaza is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years. Legends remain of how it put to rest the clash between Kyogre and Groudon.
Title: Sky High Pokémon

Name: Rayquaza
Dex Entry:
It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming
meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids
in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.
Title: Sky High Pokémon

Name: Jirachi
Dex Entry:
It’s believed that when this Pokémon wakes from
its 1,000-year slumber, it will grant any wishes
written on the notes attached to its head.
Title: Wish Pokémon

Name: Deoxys
Dex Entry:
Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly
intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon
shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.
Title: DNA Pokémon

Name: Deoxys
Dex Entry: This Deoxys has transformed into its aggressive guise. It can fool enemies by altering its appearance.
Title: DNA Pokémon

Name: Deoxys
Dex Entry: When it changes form, an aurora appears. It absorbs attacks by altering its cellular structure.
Title: DNA Pokémon

Name: Deoxys
Dex Entry: A Pokémon that mutated from an extraterrestrial virus exposed to a laser beam. Its body is configured for superior agility and speed.
Title: DNA Pokémon

Name: Turtwig
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there
is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly
damp and warm to the touch.
Title: Tiny Leaf Pokémon

Name: Grotle
Dex Entry:
Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows
on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.
Title: Grove Pokémon

Name: Torterra
Dex Entry:
This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully
as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless.
Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.
Title: Continent Pokémon

Name: Chimchar
Dex Entry:
Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the
name ”Lantern-Tail” and feared as some kind of apparition.
Title: Chimp Pokémon

Name: Monferno
Dex Entry:
The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow
to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful
blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.
Title: Playful Pokémon

Name: Infernape
Dex Entry:
A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds
itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight
to behold.
Title: Flame Pokémon

Name: Piplup
Dex Entry:
Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It's an adorable
little thing—as cute as any child—but it's also prideful, unwilling
to accept handouts from people.
Title: Penguin Pokémon

Name: Prinplup
Dex Entry:
It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice
like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity
to match.
Title: Penguin Pokémon

Name: Empoleon
Dex Entry:
Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui,
who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for
even master-crafted blades.
Title: Emperor Pokémon

Name: Starly
Dex Entry:
They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks.
Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are
strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.
Title: Starling Pokémon

Name: Staravia
Dex Entry:
They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting
amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent
plumes on their heads are the strong ones.
Title: Starling Pokémon

Name: Staraptor
Dex Entry:
It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on
its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through
the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.
Title: Predator Pokémon

Name: Bidoof
Dex Entry:
Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by
anything. There have been incidents involving Bidoof sauntering
into villages and gnawing on the houses without a single care.
Title: Plump Mouse Pokémon

Name: Bibarel
Dex Entry:
Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat
retention. These Pokémon create dams on rivers to live in.
Title: Beaver Pokémon

Name: Kricketot
Dex Entry:
When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokémon
appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together
resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.
Title: Cricket Pokémon

Name: Kricketune
Dex Entry:
It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of
which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile
endeavor to seek out one's favorite tunes.
Title: Cricket Pokémon

Name: Shinx
Dex Entry:
Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its
aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.
Title: Flash Pokémon

Name: Luxio
Dex Entry:
Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a
gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with
others of its kind.
Title: Spark Pokémon

Name: Luxray
Dex Entry:
They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say
that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon
can see through anything.
Title: Gleam Eyes Pokémon

Name: Budew
Dex Entry:
When the sun's light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémon's
head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is
over, and the season of budding has begun.
Title: Bud Pokémon

Name: Roserade
Dex Entry:
Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips
loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it
corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.
Title: Bouquet Pokémon

Name: Cranidos
Dex Entry:
An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their
heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the
area like the pealing of a bell.
Title: Head Butt Pokémon

Name: Rampardos
Dex Entry:
Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive
trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.
Title: Head Butt Pokémon

Name: Shieldon
Dex Entry:
Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever
seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict,
and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.
Title: Shield Pokémon

Name: Bastiodon
Dex Entry:
Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness
offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still
unknown, such as its natural habitat.
Title: Shield Pokémon

Name: Burmy
Dex Entry:
If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately
repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokémon within the
cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.
Title: Bagworm Pokémon

Name: Burmy
Dex Entry: It creates a cloak by weaving together sand, mud, and silk it has spat out. This earthen cloak is ruined by wind and rain, so the Pokémon hides away in caves and other such places.
Title: Bagworm Pokémon

Name: Burmy
Dex Entry: When confronted by a lack of other materials, Burmy will create its cloak using dust and refuse. The cloak seems to be more comfortable than one would think.
Title: Bagworm Pokémon

Name: Wormadam
Dex Entry:
When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of
this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.
Title: Bagworm Pokémon

Name: Wormadam
Dex Entry: Its earthen skin is reasonably hard—it has no problem repelling a Starly's pecking, at least.
Title: Bagworm Pokémon

Name: Wormadam
Dex Entry: Its body, composed of refuse, blends in to the scenery so much as to be inconspicuous. This seems to be the perfect way for the Pokémon to evade the detection of predators.
Title: Bagworm Pokémon

Name: Mothim
Dex Entry:
Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite
being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers,
Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.
Title: Moth Pokémon

Name: Combee
Dex Entry:
They swear fealty to a queen Pokémon and work diligently to
gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.
Title: Tiny Bee Pokémon

Name: Vespiquen
Dex Entry:
Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any
interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as
nourishment for itself.
Title: Beehive Pokémon

Name: Pachirisu
Dex Entry:
A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm
Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its
electrified tail or cheeks.
Title: EleSquirrel Pokémon

Name: Buizel
Dex Entry:
It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for
propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat
is coincidental.
Title: Sea Weasel Pokémon

Name: Floatzel
Dex Entry:
Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents
Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse
this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.
Title: Sea Weasel Pokémon

Name: Cherubi
Dex Entry:
Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and
plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit
then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.
Title: Cherry Pokémon

Name: Cherrim
Dex Entry:
Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of
Pokémon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the
scent exuded from Cherrim's folded petals.
Title: Blossom Pokémon

Name: Shellos
Dex Entry:
Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters.
Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any
person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!
Title: Sea Slug Pokémon

Name: Gastrodon
Dex Entry:
Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon
encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.
Title: Sea Slug Pokémon

Name: Ambipom
Dex Entry:
To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring
by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions,
humans have been accepted into such rings.
Title: Long Tail Pokémon

Name: Drifloon
Dex Entry:
Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the
afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated
human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.
Title: Balloon Pokémon

Name: Drifblim
Dex Entry:
It drifts along at dusk, perfectly silent. Its transient, melancholy
aspect touches some people deeply—every so often, one will
come upon a song or poem devoted to Drifblim.
Title: Blimp Pokémon

Name: Buneary
Dex Entry:
My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its
hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its
hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.
Title: Rabbit Pokémon

Name: Lopunny
Dex Entry:
Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as
though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents
with ease.
Title: Rabbit Pokémon

Name: Lopunny
Dex Entry: It swings its ears like whips and strikes its enemies with them. It has an intensely combative disposition.
Title: Rabbit Pokémon

Name: Mismagius
Dex Entry:
The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune,
so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the
Pokémon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.
Title: Magical Pokémon

Name: Honchkrow
Dex Entry:
One cry from this Pokémon, and a murder of Murkrow come
flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had
fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.
Title: Big Boss Pokémon

Name: Glameow
Dex Entry:
Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze.
Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon
an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.
Title: Catty Pokémon

Name: Purugly
Dex Entry:
Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great
popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses
even velveteen.
Title: Tiger Cat Pokémon

Name: Chingling
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it
seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are
some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.
Title: Bell Pokémon

Name: Stunky
Dex Entry:
The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an
utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can
induce memory loss.
Title: Skunk Pokémon

Name: Skuntank
Dex Entry:
Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable
to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested
prey uneaten.
Title: Skunk Pokémon

Name: Bronzor
Dex Entry:
Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its
back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery
from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.
Title: Bronze Pokémon

Name: Bronzong
Dex Entry:
Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world.
It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.
Title: Bronze Bell Pokémon

Name: Bonsly
Dex Entry:
Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do
not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a
physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.
Title: Bonsai Pokémon

Name: Mime Jr.
Dex Entry:
Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again.
It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they
react, eyes sparkling.
Title: Mime Pokémon

Name: Happiny
Dex Entry:
In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its
belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with
children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.
Title: Playhouse Pokémon

Name: Chatot
Dex Entry:
A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech.
It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even
understand the meaning of the words they mimic.
Title: Music Note Pokémon

Name: Spiritomb
Dex Entry:
It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this
Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight
malevolent spirits.
Title: Forbidden Pokémon

Name: Gible
Dex Entry:
It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall
out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within
a few days.
Title: Land Shark Pokémon

Name: Gabite
Dex Entry:
Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave
one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly
became quite docile.
Title: Cave Pokémon

Name: Garchomp
Dex Entry:
Soars across the heavens at blinding speed—a magnificent sight!
It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one
meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.
Title: Mach Pokémon

Name: Garchomp
Dex Entry: Its disposition is more vicious than before its Mega Evolution. Garchomp carves its opponents up with the scythes on both arms.
Title: Mach Pokémon

Name: Munchlax
Dex Entry:
Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted
matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food
scraps intended for compost.
Title: Big Eater Pokémon

Name: Riolu
Dex Entry:
Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to
read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with
Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.
Title: Emanation Pokémon

Name: Lucario
Dex Entry:
A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and
controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway
beings. I have given the name ”aura” to this power.
Title: Aura Pokémon

Name: Lucario
Dex Entry: Bathed in explosive energy, its combative instincts have awakened. For its enemies, it has no mercy whatsoever.
Title: Aura Pokémon

Name: Hippopotas
Dex Entry:
Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect
due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil.
When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.
Title: Hippo Pokémon

Name: Hippowdon
Dex Entry:
Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up
whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes' spirits, then goes in for
the attack.
Title: Heavyweight Pokémon

Name: Skorupi
Dex Entry:
Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi
a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold
temperatures, however.
Title: Scorpion Pokémon

Name: Drapion
Dex Entry:
Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength
and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages
about and wreaks havoc.
Title: Ogre Scorpion Pokémon

Name: Croagunk
Dex Entry:
A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such
qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due
to its peculiar cry and comical features.
Title: Toxic Mouth Pokémon

Name: Toxicroak
Dex Entry:
Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made
into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild
grass, and boiling it down over two days.
Title: Toxic Mouth Pokémon

Name: Carnivine
Dex Entry:
Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly
temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw
wide open.
Title: Bug Catcher Pokémon

Name: Finneon
Dex Entry:
What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long,
pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful
appearance has led to its nickname: ”finery fish.”
Title: Wing Fish Pokémon

Name: Lumineon
Dex Entry:
Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon
schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking—
it's as though there were shining stars right there.
Title: Neon Pokémon

Name: Mantyke
Dex Entry:
Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer.
I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with
schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.
Title: Kite Pokémon

Name: Snover
Dex Entry:
One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow.
There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but
doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.
Title: Frost Tree Pokémon

Name: Abomasnow
Dex Entry: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
Title: Frost Tree Pokémon

Name: Abomasnow
Dex Entry:
A powerful Pokémon that can split huge boulders with ease.
Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep
within the mountains, playing with the snow.
Title: Frost Tree Pokémon

Name: Weavile
Dex Entry:
This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of
a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to
speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.
Title: Sharp Claw Pokémon

Name: Magnezone
Dex Entry:
I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon,
changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits
strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.
Title: Magnet Area Pokémon

Name: Lickilicky
Dex Entry:
Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of
reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the
saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.
Title: Licking Pokémon

Name: Rhyperior
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike
hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a
blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.
Title: Drill Pokémon

Name: Tangrowth
Dex Entry:
Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance.
It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping
them around prey to ensnare them.
Title: Vine Pokémon

Name: Electivire
Dex Entry:
Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical
output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can
unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.
Title: Thunderbolt Pokémon

Name: Magmortar
Dex Entry:
Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs
launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to
melt an iron pot in an instant.
Title: Blast Pokémon

Name: Togekiss
Dex Entry:
Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what
literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when
peace reigns in the land.
Title: Jubilee Pokémon

Name: Yanmega
Dex Entry:
Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy,
aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage
to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.
Title: Ogre Darner Pokémon

Name: Leafeon
Dex Entry:
Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur.
Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's
sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.
Title: Verdant Pokémon

Name: Glaceon
Dex Entry:
Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly.
It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters
like gems while it flutters and dances around.
Title: Fresh Snow Pokémon

Name: Gliscor
Dex Entry:
It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs
into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once
it has entirely drained its prey of blood.
Title: Fang Scorpion Pokémon

Name: Mamoswine
Dex Entry:
This species reached its zenith during the period known as the
ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with
Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.
Title: Twin Tusk Pokémon

Name: Porygon-Z
Dex Entry:
A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon's offensive
capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its
behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.
Title: Virtual Pokémon

Name: Gallade
Dex Entry: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
Title: Blade Pokémon

Name: Gallade
Dex Entry:
The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the
finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is
astonishingly impressive.
Title: Blade Pokémon

Name: Probopass
Dex Entry:
It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over
the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron
sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.
Title: Compass Pokémon

Name: Dusknoir
Dex Entry:
Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts
their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of
those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.
Title: Gripper Pokémon

Name: Froslass
Dex Entry:
A Pokémon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing
a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing
deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.
Title: Snow Land Pokémon

Name: Rotom
Dex Entry:
This bizarre Pokémon appears to be a will-o'-the-wisp powered
by electricity. Be wary, as Rotom is both smart and mischievous.
Title: Plasma Pokémon

Name: Rotom
Dex Entry: This Rotom has possessed a convection microwave oven that uses a special motor. It also has a flair for manipulating flames.
Title: Plasma Pokémon

Name: Rotom
Dex Entry: This Rotom has possessed a washing machine that uses a special motor. It blasts out water to get enemies to back down.
Title: Plasma Pokémon

Name: Rotom
Dex Entry: Rotom assumes this form when it takes over a refrigerator powered by a special motor. It battles by spewing cold air.
Title: Plasma Pokémon

Name: Rotom
Dex Entry: This Rotom has taken over a fan that has a special motor. Its gusts of wind blow its opponents away!
Title: Plasma Pokémon

Name: Rotom
Dex Entry: This is Rotom after it's seized control of a lawn mower that has a special motor. As it mows down grass, it scatters the clippings everywhere.
Title: Plasma Pokémon

Name: Uxie
Dex Entry:
A Pokémon feared but also respected for stealing away the
memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie
holds dominion over knowledge.
Title: Knowledge Pokémon

Name: Mesprit
Dex Entry:
Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was
feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their
emotions thrown into disarray.
Title: Emotion Pokémon

Name: Azelf
Dex Entry:
The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémon
manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into
puppets of its own.
Title: Willpower Pokémon

Name: Dialga
Dex Entry: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
Title: Temporal Pokémon

Name: Dialga
Dex Entry: Radiant light caused Dialga to take on a form bearing a striking resemblance to the creator Pokémon. Dialga now wields such colossal strength that one must conclude this is its true form.
Title: Temporal Pokémon

Name: Palkia
Dex Entry: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
Title: Spatial Pokémon

Name: Palkia
Dex Entry: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia's strategy for gaining Arceus's powers.
Title: Spatial Pokémon

Name: Heatran
Dex Entry:
Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling
magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds
many mysteries.
Title: Lava Dome Pokémon

Name: Regigigas
Dex Entry:
According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and
bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I
have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.
Title: Colossal Pokémon

Name: Giratina
Dex Entry: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
Title: Renegade Pokémon

Name: Giratina
Dex Entry: Giratina loses its legs upon changing into this form. I believe this Pokémon must hail from a world where the heavens and the earth are as one, though I have no way of proving it.
Title: Renegade Pokémon

Name: Cresselia
Dex Entry:
Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant
line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay
it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.
Title: Lunar Pokémon

Name: Phione
Dex Entry:
Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are
warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic
suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.
Title: Sea Drifter Pokémon

Name: Manaphy
Dex Entry:
Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui's coastal
waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is
also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.
Title: Seafaring Pokémon

Name: Darkrai
Dex Entry:
On a moonless night, a strange incident occurred in which every
one of a village's inhabitants suffered nightmares. The villagers
attested that Darkrai appeared before them in these nightmares.
Title: Pitch-Black Pokémon

Name: Shaymin
Dex Entry:
When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end
and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin
appears and covers the withered land with flowers.
Title: Gratitude Pokémon

Name: Shaymin
Dex Entry: Upon taking in the scent of a particular rare flower, Shaymin is enveloped in light, and its tiny body transforms. I took a whiff of the flower myself, but alas, my body remained unchanged.
Title: Gratitude Pokémon

Name: Arceus
Dex Entry:
It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines
across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon.
Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.
Title: Alpha Pokémon

Name: Victini
Dex Entry:
When it shares the infinite energy it creates,
that being’s entire body will be overflowing
with power.
Title: Victory Pokémon

Name: Snivy
Dex Entry:
They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in
sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their
tails droop.
Title: Grass Snake Pokémon

Name: Servine
Dex Entry:
When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in
photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
Title: Grass Snake Pokémon

Name: Serperior
Dex Entry:
It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a
glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts
it internally.
Title: Regal Pokémon

Name: Tepig
Dex Entry:
It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it
gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
Title: Fire Pig Pokémon

Name: Pignite
Dex Entry:
When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow
sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
Title: Fire Pig Pokémon

Name: Emboar
Dex Entry:
It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves.
It grows a beard of fire.
Title: Mega Fire Pig Pokémon

Name: Oshawott
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly
as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this
shell the name ”scalchop”.
Title: Sea Otter Pokémon

Name: Dewott
Dex Entry:
Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of
daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing
in defeat.
Title: Discipline Pokémon

Name: Samurott
Dex Entry: A master of a sword-drawing art called iaijutsu, Samurott settles its battles with a single swing of either large sword sheathed in its foreleg armor.
Title: Formidable Pokémon

Name: Samurott
Dex Entry:
Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is
a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its
turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
Title: Formidable Pokémon

Name: Patrat
Dex Entry:
Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on
the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming
from behind.
Title: Scout Pokémon

Name: Watchog
Dex Entry:
When they see an enemy, their tails stand high,
and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their
cheek pouches.
Title: Lookout Pokémon

Name: Lillipup
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon is far brighter than the average
child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it
receives or any abuse it suffers.
Title: Puppy Pokémon

Name: Herdier
Dex Entry:
The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body
is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce
right off.
Title: Loyal Dog Pokémon

Name: Stoutland
Dex Entry:
Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive
moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what
determines social standing among this species.
Title: Big-Hearted Pokémon

Name: Purrloin
Dex Entry:
Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable
behavior come away with stinging scratches from
its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.
Title: Devious Pokémon

Name: Liepard
Dex Entry:
This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey
without making any sound at all. It competes with
Thievul for territory.
Title: Cruel Pokémon

Name: Pansage
Dex Entry:
It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from
all over. It’s kind enough to share them
with friends.
Title: Grass Monkey Pokémon

Name: Simisage
Dex Entry:
Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail
around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is
very bitter.
Title: Thorn Monkey Pokémon

Name: Pansear
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes.
The fire within the tuft on its head can reach
600 degrees Fahrenheit.
Title: High Temp Pokémon

Name: Simisear
Dex Entry:
When it gets excited, embers rise from its head
and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it
loves sweets.
Title: Ember Pokémon

Name: Panpour
Dex Entry:
The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of
nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
Title: Spray Pokémon

Name: Simipour
Dex Entry:
It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs
low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with
its tail.
Title: Geyser Pokémon

Name: Munna
Dex Entry:
It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink
when it’s eating a good dream, and black when
it’s eating a nightmare.
Title: Dream Eater Pokémon

Name: Musharna
Dex Entry:
It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to
leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible
grump when freshly roused from sleep.
Title: Drowsing Pokémon

Name: Pidove
Dex Entry:
It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many
Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness
and sincerity.
Title: Tiny Pigeon Pokémon

Name: Tranquill
Dex Entry:
These bright Pokémon have acute memories.
Apparently delivery workers often choose them
as their partners.
Title: Wild Pigeon Pokémon

Name: Unfezant
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud.
People will sit up and take notice if you become
the Trainer of one.
Title: Proud Pokémon

Name: Blitzle
Dex Entry:
Its mane shines when it discharges electricity.
They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes
to communicate.
Title: Electrified Pokémon

Name: Zebstrika
Dex Entry:
They have lightning-like movements.
When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of
thunder reverberates.
Title: Thunderbolt Pokémon

Name: Roggenrola
Dex Entry:
When it detects a noise, it starts to move.
The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon
slightly warm to the touch.
Title: Mantle Pokémon

Name: Boldore
Dex Entry:
It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its
vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever
changing the direction it’s facing.
Title: Ore Pokémon

Name: Gigalith
Dex Entry:
Although its energy blasts can blow away
a dump truck, they have a limitation—
they can only be fired when the sun is out.
Title: Compressed Pokémon

Name: Woobat
Dex Entry:
It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about,
searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.
Title: Bat Pokémon

Name: Swoobat
Dex Entry:
The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose
apparently led some regions to consider
Swoobat a symbol of good luck.
Title: Courting Pokémon

Name: Drilbur
Dex Entry:
It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the
ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so
many farmers have little love for it.
Title: Mole Pokémon

Name: Excadrill
Dex Entry:
Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can
tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over
90 mph.
Title: Subterrene Pokémon

Name: Audino
Dex Entry: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
Title: Hearing Pokémon

Name: Audino
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with
its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’
feelings and physical conditions.
Title: Hearing Pokémon

Name: Timburr
Dex Entry:
Timburr that have started carrying logs that are
about three times their size are nearly ready
to evolve.
Title: Muscular Pokémon

Name: Gurdurr
Dex Entry:
Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not
its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this
Pokémon wields its metal beam.
Title: Muscular Pokémon

Name: Conkeldurr
Dex Entry:
When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside
its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to
pummel them with its fists.
Title: Muscular Pokémon

Name: Tympole
Dex Entry:
It uses sound waves to communicate with
others of its kind. People and other Pokémon
species can’t hear its cries of warning.
Title: Tadpole Pokémon

Name: Palpitoad
Dex Entry:
On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to
the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their
bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
Title: Vibration Pokémon

Name: Seismitoad
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon is popular among the elderly,
who say the vibrations of its lumps are great
for massages.
Title: Vibration Pokémon

Name: Throh
Dex Entry:
They train in groups of five. Any member that
can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave
the group.
Title: Judo Pokémon

Name: Sawk
Dex Entry:
The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself
to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
Title: Karate Pokémon

Name: Sewaddle
Dex Entry:
Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of
leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
Title: Sewing Pokémon

Name: Swadloon
Dex Entry:
It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in
leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves
in forests.
Title: Leaf-Wrapped Pokémon

Name: Leavanny
Dex Entry:
It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting
leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings
for Sewaddle.
Title: Nurturing Pokémon

Name: Venipede
Dex Entry:
Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon
finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them
without any thought of how things might turn out.
Title: Centipede Pokémon

Name: Whirlipede
Dex Entry:
Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and
poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll
need for evolution.
Title: Curlipede Pokémon

Name: Scolipede
Dex Entry:
Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with
Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles,
the victor makes a meal of the loser.
Title: Megapede Pokémon

Name: Cottonee
Dex Entry:
Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee
and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s
highly prized by many luxury brands.
Title: Cotton Puff Pokémon

Name: Whimsicott
Dex Entry:
As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its
cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff
builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.
Title: Windveiled Pokémon

Name: Petilil
Dex Entry:
The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes.
Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter
decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.
Title: Bulb Pokémon

Name: Lilligant
Dex Entry: It's believed that even first-rate gardeners have a hard time getting the flower on a Lilligant's head to bloom.
Title: Flowering Pokémon

Name: Lilligant
Dex Entry:
Its well-developed legs are the result of a life
spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes
from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
Title: Spinning Pokémon

Name: Basculin
Dex Entry: Its temperament is vicious and aggressive. This Pokémon is also full of vitality and can multiply rapidly before anyone notices.
Title: Hostile Pokémon

Name: Basculin
Dex Entry: These Pokémon form schools with others of the same color. The greatest foe of a school of blue Basculin is a school of red Basculin.
Title: Hostile Pokémon

Name: Basculin
Dex Entry: Its ecology is starkly different from that of other Basculin, so theories that it's a totally different species have gained traction in recent years.
Title: Mellow Pokémon

Name: Sandile
Dex Entry:
Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are
powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile
moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.
Title: Desert Croc Pokémon

Name: Krokorok
Dex Entry:
Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that
allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move
much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.
Title: Desert Croc Pokémon

Name: Krookodile
Dex Entry:
While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has
the patience to stay hidden under sand for days,
lying in wait for prey.
Title: Intimidation Pokémon

Name: Darumaka
Dex Entry:
This popular symbol of good fortune will never
fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed
or pulled.
Title: Zen Charm Pokémon

Name: Darumaka
Dex Entry: The colder they get, the more energetic they are. They freeze their breath to make snowballs, using them as ammo for playful snowball fights.
Title: Zen Charm Pokémon

Name: Darmanitan
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon’s power level rises along with the
temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500
degrees Fahrenheit.
Title: Blazing Pokémon

Name: Darmanitan
Dex Entry: When wounded, it stops moving. It goes as still as stone to meditate, sharpening its mind and spirit.
Title: Zen Charm Pokémon

Name: Darmanitan
Dex Entry: Though it has a gentle disposition, it's also very strong. It will quickly freeze the snowball on its head before going for a headbutt.
Title: Zen Charm Pokémon

Name: Darmanitan
Dex Entry: Darmanitan takes this form when enraged. It won't stop spewing flames until its rage has settled, even if its body starts to melt.
Title: Zen Charm Pokémon

Name: Maractus
Dex Entry:
Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds.
They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them
a precious food source out in the desert.
Title: Cactus Pokémon

Name: Dwebble
Dex Entry:
It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there
are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may
move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.
Title: Rock Inn Pokémon

Name: Crustle
Dex Entry:
Its thick claws are its greatest weapons.
They’re mighty enough to crack
Rhyperior’s carapace.
Title: Stone Home Pokémon

Name: Scraggy
Dex Entry:
It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought
that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has
completely stretched out.
Title: Shedding Pokémon

Name: Scrafty
Dex Entry:
While mostly known for having the temperament
of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very
good care of its family, friends, and territory.
Title: Hoodlum Pokémon

Name: Sigilyph
Dex Entry:
A discovery was made in the desert where
Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been
an ancient city were found beneath the sands.
Title: Avianoid Pokémon

Name: Yamask
Dex Entry:
The spirit of a person from a bygone age became
this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching
for someone who knows its face.
Title: Spirit Pokémon

Name: Yamask
Dex Entry: It's said that this Pokémon was formed when an ancient clay tablet was drawn to a vengeful spirit.
Title: Spirit Pokémon

Name: Cofagrigus
Dex Entry:
There are many depictions of Cofagrigus
decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols
of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.
Title: Coffin Pokémon

Name: Tirtouga
Dex Entry:
Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of
many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life
from a fossil.
Title: Prototurtle Pokémon

Name: Carracosta
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon emerges from the water in search
of prey despite the fact that it moves more
slowly on land.
Title: Prototurtle Pokémon

Name: Archen
Dex Entry:
Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird
Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries
and bug Pokémon.
Title: First Bird Pokémon

Name: Archeops
Dex Entry:
Though capable of flight, Archeops was
apparently better at hunting on the ground.
Title: First Bird Pokémon

Name: Trubbish
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with
trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched
by Trubbish.
Title: Trash Bag Pokémon

Name: Garbodor
Dex Entry:
The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm
is so virulent that it can kill a weakened
creature instantly.
Title: Trash Heap Pokémon

Name: Garbodor
Dex Entry: It sprays toxic gas from its mouth and fingers. If the gas engulfs you, the toxins will seep in all the way down to your bones.
Title: Trash Heap Pokémon

Name: Zorua
Dex Entry: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.
Title: Tricky Fox Pokémon

Name: Zorua
Dex Entry:
A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power
from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes
on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
Title: Spiteful Fox Pokémon

Name: Zoroark
Dex Entry: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
Title: Illusion Fox Pokémon

Name: Zoroark
Dex Entry:
With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of
death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses
with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.
Title: Baneful Fox Pokémon

Name: Minccino
Dex Entry:
They pet each other with their tails as a form of
greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier
is a bit more boastful.
Title: Chinchilla Pokémon

Name: Cinccino
Dex Entry:
A special oil that seeps through their fur helps
them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price
at market.
Title: Scarf Pokémon

Name: Gothita
Dex Entry:
Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita
can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe
it’s speaking to something only it can see.
Title: Fixation Pokémon

Name: Gothorita
Dex Entry:
On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s
psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just
what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.
Title: Manipulate Pokémon

Name: Gothitelle
Dex Entry:
A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle
went missing that same day and was never
seen again.
Title: Astral Body Pokémon

Name: Solosis
Dex Entry:
Many say that the special liquid covering this
Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in
the vacuum of space.
Title: Cell Pokémon

Name: Duosion
Dex Entry:
Its brain has split into two, and the two
halves rarely think alike. Its actions are
utterly unpredictable.
Title: Mitosis Pokémon

Name: Reuniclus
Dex Entry:
It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding
Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is
highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.
Title: Multiplying Pokémon

Name: Ducklett
Dex Entry:
They are better at swimming than flying, and they
happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they
dive underwater.
Title: Water Bird Pokémon

Name: Swanna
Dex Entry:
Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in
the middle is the leader of the flock.
Title: White Bird Pokémon

Name: Vanillite
Dex Entry:
Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an
icicle. It spews out freezing air at ?58 degrees
Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
Title: Fresh Snow Pokémon

Name: Vanillish
Dex Entry:
It blasts enemies with cold air reaching ?148
degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it
spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.
Title: Icy Snow Pokémon

Name: Vanilluxe
Dex Entry:
People believe this Pokémon formed when two
Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is
roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

Name: Deerling

Title: Season Pokémon

Name: Deerling
Dex Entry: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In this form, Deerling have a softly sweet scent that lingers in the nose.
Title: Season Pokémon

Name: Deerling
Dex Entry: Deerling’s scent changes with the seasons, but when the Pokémon is in its Winter Form, it has hardly any scent at all.
Title: Season Pokémon

Name: Sawsbuck
Dex Entry: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The paler the pink flowers that bloom on its antlers, the more beautiful the Sawsbuck is considered to be.
Title: Season Pokémon

Name: Sawsbuck
Dex Entry: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The thicker and larger the branches and leaves on its antlers, the more majestic the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
Title: Season Pokémon

Name: Sawsbuck
Dex Entry: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The darker the red of the foliage that hangs from its antlers, the more stylish the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
Title: Season Pokémon

Name: Sawsbuck
Dex Entry: Though there are many enthusiasts for Sawsbuck as a species, this seasonal form in particular is not very popular.
Title: Season Pokémon

Name: Emolga
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries.
Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much
food that it can’t fly properly.
Title: Sky Squirrel Pokémon

Name: Karrablast
Dex Entry:
It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through
Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell—
it eats only the contents.
Title: Clamping Pokémon

Name: Escavalier
Dex Entry:
It charges its enemies, lances at the ready.
An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous
painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.
Title: Cavalry Pokémon

Name: Foongus
Dex Entry:
The spores released from this Pokémon’s hands
are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried,
the spores can be used as stomach medicine.
Title: Mushroom Pokémon

Name: Amoonguss
Dex Entry:
Amoonguss generally doesn’t move much. It
tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have
been dropped on the ground.
Title: Mushroom Pokémon

Name: Frillish
Dex Entry:
Legend has it that the residents of a sunken
ancient city changed into these Pokémon.
Title: Floating Pokémon

Name: Jellicent
Dex Entry:
Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky,
schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of
the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.
Title: Floating Pokémon

Name: Alomomola
Dex Entry:
The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened
condition is that any Pokémon coming after
them may also attack Alomomola.
Title: Caring Pokémon

Name: Joltik
Dex Entry:
Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out
static electricity. They’re often found sticking to
Yamper’s hindquarters.
Title: Attaching Pokémon

Name: Galvantula
Dex Entry:
It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests
of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are
not yet good at flying.
Title: EleSpider Pokémon

Name: Ferroseed
Dex Entry:
Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings.
Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s
spikes grow big and strong.
Title: Thorn Seed Pokémon

Name: Ferrothorn
Dex Entry:
Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon
crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes
on its feelers into the stone.
Title: Thorn Pod Pokémon

Name: Klink
Dex Entry:
It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration
behind ancient people’s invention of the
first gears.
Title: Gear Pokémon

Name: Klang
Dex Entry:
Many companies in the Galar region choose
Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered
the symbol of industrial technology.
Title: Gear Pokémon

Name: Klinklang
Dex Entry:
The three gears that compose this Pokémon
spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t
a living creature.
Title: Gear Pokémon

Name: Tynamo
Dex Entry:
One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity,
so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful
electric shock.
Title: EleFish Pokémon

Name: Eelektrik
Dex Entry:
These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they
spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it
with electricity.
Title: EleFish Pokémon

Name: Eelektross
Dex Entry:
They crawl out of the ocean using their arms.
They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag
it into the ocean.
Title: EleFish Pokémon

Name: Elgyem
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years
ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to
exert its psychic powers.
Title: Cerebral Pokémon

Name: Beheeyem
Dex Entry:
Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields,
this Pokémon can control the memories of
its opponents.
Title: Cerebral Pokémon

Name: Litwick
Dex Entry:
The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs,
the brighter and eerier the flame on its
head burns.
Title: Candle Pokémon

Name: Lampent
Dex Entry:
It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp.
Once it finds someone whose death is near,
it will trail quietly after them.
Title: Lamp Pokémon

Name: Chandelure
Dex Entry:
In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of
lights, funerals were a constant occurrence—
or so it’s said.
Title: Luring Pokémon

Name: Axew
Dex Entry:
They play with each other by knocking their large
tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but
they grow back so quickly that it isn’t a concern.
Title: Tusk Pokémon

Name: Fraxure
Dex Entry:
Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s
favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents,
stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.
Title: Axe Jaw Pokémon

Name: Haxorus
Dex Entry:
While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if
angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams
are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.
Title: Axe Jaw Pokémon

Name: Cubchoo
Dex Entry:
It sniffles before performing a move, using its
frosty snot to provide an icy element to any
move that needs it.
Title: Chill Pokémon

Name: Beartic
Dex Entry:
It swims energetically through frigid seas.
When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater
with its breath so it can rest on the ice.
Title: Freezing Pokémon

Name: Cryogonal
Dex Entry:
When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn
into water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never
seen during summer.
Title: Crystallizing Pokémon

Name: Shelmet
Dex Entry:
It has a strange physiology that responds to
electricity. When together with Karrablast,
Shelmet evolves for some reason.
Title: Snail Pokémon

Name: Accelgor
Dex Entry:
Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep
itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in
bands of membrane.
Title: Shell Out Pokémon

Name: Stunfisk
Dex Entry:
For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly
when it emits a strong electric current from the
yellow markings on its body.
Title: Trap Pokémon

Name: Stunfisk
Dex Entry: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its jagged steel fins down on them.
Title: Trap Pokémon

Name: Mienfoo
Dex Entry:
Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce.
Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly
will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.
Title: Martial Arts Pokémon

Name: Mienshao
Dex Entry:
Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this
Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into
tiny pieces.
Title: Martial Arts Pokémon

Name: Druddigon
Dex Entry:
Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up
residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon,
treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.
Title: Cave Pokémon

Name: Golett
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon was created from clay. It received
orders from its master many thousands of years
ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.
Title: Automaton Pokémon

Name: Golurk
Dex Entry:
There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual
motion machine that produces limitless energy,
but this belief hasn’t been proven.
Title: Automaton Pokémon

Name: Pawniard
Dex Entry:
A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a
Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently,
dreaming of one day taking the lead.
Title: Sharp Blade Pokémon

Name: Bisharp
Dex Entry:
Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and
Fraxure over places where sharpening stones
can be found.
Title: Sword Blade Pokémon

Name: Bouffalant
Dex Entry:
These Pokémon live in herds of about 20
individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will
lose the hair on their heads for some reason.
Title: Bash Buffalo Pokémon

Name: Rufflet
Dex Entry:
Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its
parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.
Title: Eaglet Pokémon

Name: Braviary
Dex Entry: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
Title: Valiant Pokémon

Name: Braviary
Dex Entry:
Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious
bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock
waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.
Title: Battle Cry Pokémon

Name: Vullaby
Dex Entry:
Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too
small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed
down to younger ones in the nest.
Title: Diapered Pokémon

Name: Mandibuzz
Dex Entry:
They adorn themselves with bones. There seem
to be fashion trends among them, as different
bones come into and fall out of popularity.
Title: Bone Vulture Pokémon

Name: Heatmor
Dex Entry:
A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the
hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour
their insides.

With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can
crunch their way through rock. They work
together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.
Title: Iron Ant Pokémon

Name: Deino
Dex Entry:
Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly
biting at everything it touches, trying to keep
track of its surroundings.
Title: Irate Pokémon

Name: Zweilous
Dex Entry:
Their two heads will fight each other over a
single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in
scars even without battling others.
Title: Hostile Pokémon

Name: Hydreigon
Dex Entry:
The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into
the opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their
target goes down.
Title: Brutal Pokémon

Name: Larvesta

Larvesta’s body is warm all over. It spouts fire

and scare prey.
Title: Torch Pokémon

Name: Volcarona
Dex Entry:
This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of
raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as
a deity of fire.
Title: Sun Pokémon

From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon

calm even vicious foes.

Title: Cyclone Pokémon

Name: Thundurus
Dex Entry:
They say this wielder of electricity has waged war with its

Title: Bolt Strike Pokémon

Name: Thundurus

Title: Bolt Strike Pokémon

Name: Reshiram

temperature increases sharply. If you touch a

The temperature of its breath is over 10,000

Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s

healing properties.

It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its
heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives

a battle of clashing horns.

love for Spritzee.

The scents Aromatisse can produce range from
sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells
that sap an opponent’s will to fight.

The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes
Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out
sticky string to tangle up its enemies.
Title: Cotton Candy Pokémon

Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft
to the touch and lighter than it looks.
Title: Meringue Pokémon

luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them,

a role in certain history-changing events.

to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.
